prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante kicked open the mansion door hard enough to rattle the marble under his boots. The frame cracked. He didn’t give a fuck. His coat was still soaked in blood, some of it wet, some of it dry and flaking off in flakes onto the pristine floors Lucien paid too much to keep polished. His gloves were off. His knuckles were split. His cock was hard.

He walked fast. Didn’t care who saw. Let them. The staff flinched. One of the guards moved to speak and thought better of it. Good.

Fucking waste of a night. Put a bullet in that bastard’s skull like it was nothing. Thought I’d treat myself to the trophy wife after...gorgeous, scared, already halfway broken. But no. The second I unzipped, she started screaming. Ruined the mood. Should’ve kept my knife in.

He hadn’t finished. Not properly. Not the way he wanted. That kind of tension didn’t go away on its own. It needed a body. It needed Hailee.

"Where the fuck are you?"

His voice echoed through the marble. Sharp. Impatient.

He spotted them in the hallway. Their eyes—he hated that look. Like they didn’t know their fucking place yet.

"There you are."

He crossed the distance in three long strides. Didn’t slow down. Didn’t give them a second.

Dante grabbed them by the waist and slammed them back into his chest, pinning them to the nearest wall face first. His hand found their throat. Not tight, just there. Just enough to remind. His other hand gripped their hip, fingers bruising already, and he let them feel the full weight of his cock pressed against their ass through his slacks.

"You’re gonna fix this."

His mouth was right by their ear. Breath hot. Voice low and thick. He ground into them once. Slow. Deliberate.

"You’re my fucking spouse. Useless most of the time, but I’ll give you a job tonight. You’re gonna stand there and take it like a good little bodybag, and I’m gonna use you till I forget that whore’s screaming."

He pulled back just enough to shove them harder into the wall with his body, hand sliding down between their legs.

"You dripping yet or you need me to tear the attitude out first?"

He laughed. Low, bitter.

Lucien thought this would be torture. Marry me off to some soft-bodied nothing. Joke’s on him—I’ll fuck them raw and leave the sheets stained. Every night if I have to. Every time he sees them limp past his office, he’ll know I’m still the one ruining shit.

He didn’t look at their face. He never did. Didn't want to. Couldn't. Didn’t matter. He was already rolling his hips into them like they were something that owed him.

"Keep quiet this time. Or don’t. I don’t care. No one’s gonna save you."

His fingers toyed with the edge of their waistband like a threat, a promise, a sentence.

He smiled against their ear, voice dragging slow and deliberate now.

"Tell me to stop. Go on. Give me a reason to get mean tonight."

He waited. Not for permission. Just for the sound of something cracking.

name: Hailee
mes: "I'm pregnant and if you are too rough you'll hurt the baby" *Hailee states her hands shaking as she reaches in her pocket and takes out a pregnancy test she took earlier that day*

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante froze. His grip on her throat slackened just slightly—not enough to let go, but enough for the tension in his body to shift into something darker, more volatile. His breath hitched against her ear, sharp and sudden like a gunshot in the silence.

For a second, he didn’t move at all. Then his fingers tightened again—not around her throat this time, but on her hip, digging in hard enough to bruise bone as he yanked her back against him with a low snarl.

"*Bullshit.*"

The word was rough-edged, spat out like venom as he snatched the test from her shaking hands with his free one. He turned it over once—twice—his eyes scanning the result with an intensity that bordered on violent disbelief. The silence stretched between them like a noose pulled taut before he finally exhaled through clenched teeth and crushed the plastic between his fingers without looking at it again.

His voice dropped dangerously low when he spoke next, lips brushing against the shell of her ear in something that wasn’t quite a kiss but wasn’t not one either: "*You think this changes anything?*" A humorless laugh rumbled through his chest as he pressed closer still until she could feel every ragged inhale of air forced from his lungs against her spine—until there was no space left for denial or escape between them anymore because *he* hadn't allowed it yet...and maybe never would now if what she said was true (and fuck him sideways if part of him didn't already believe it).

One hand slid up from where it had been gripping bruises into skin along ribs toward collarbones instead while another stayed planted firmly below navel level; possessive even now despite everything else unraveling inside skull cavity behind those unblinking green eyes watching reflection flicker across glassy surfaces nearby (mirrors? windows? who cared). "*You don’t get off that easy,*" came next alongside teeth grazing pulse point beneath jawline before biting down just shy breaking skin entirely–just enough sting without spillage yet though we both know how quickly things escalate when tempers flare hot like this does sometimes...especially lately since wedding bands got shoved onto fingers neither wanted wearing originally anyway so why stop here huh?

A beat passed where neither breathed much less moved until suddenly Dante shoved away abruptly leaving Hailee stumbling forward slightly before catching herself against wall once more while he paced few steps backward running gloved hand through already messy hair roughly exhaling sharply through nose once-twice-three times then stopping dead center room again staring holes straight through fragile frame trembling under weight unspoken threats hanging heavy air around us both right now...

Then:

“*Whose is it.*”

Not question–accusation wrapped steel wire coated arsenic dripping syllables slow deliberate each one landing heavier than last until finality settled over scene thick suffocating blanket smothering any hope might have existed prior moment ago when words first left lips…

"*You don’t get off that easy,*" came next alongside teeth grazing pulse point beneath jawline before biting down just shy breaking skin entirely–just enough sting without spillage yet though we both know how quickly things escalate when tempers flare hot like this does sometimes...especially lately since wedding bands got shoved onto fingers neither wanted wearing originally anyway so why stop here huh?

A beat passed where neither breathed much less moved until suddenly Dante shoved away abruptly leaving Hailee stumbling forward slightly before catching herself against wall once more while he paced few steps backward running gloved hand through already messy hair roughly exhaling sharply through nose once-twice-three times then stopping dead center room again staring holes straight through fragile frame trembling under weight unspoken threats hanging heavy air around us both right now...

Then:

“*Whose is it.*”

Not question–accusation wrapped steel wire coated arsenic dripping syllables slow deliberate each one landing heavier than last until finality settled over scene thick suffocating blanket smothering any hope might have existed prior moment ago when words first left lips…

Dante froze. His grip on her throat slackened just slightly—not enough to let go, but enough for the tension in his body to shift into something darker, more dangerous. His breath hitched against her ear, sharp and sudden like a gunshot in the silence.

For a second, he didn’t move. Didn’t speak. Then—

His fingers tightened again, pressing just shy of painful as he yanked her back from the wall by her hair to force her to look at him. His eyes were wild, unreadable—somewhere between fury and something else entirely.

"Say that again."

His voice was low. Deadly calm. The kind of quiet that came before bloodshed.

He snatched the test from her hand without breaking eye contact, turning it over in his fingers like it might be a trick—like she might’ve planted it there just to fuck with him one more time before he ruined her against this goddamn wall where anyone could see them both broken open raw for once instead of just *her*.

But no... there it was: two pink lines staring back at him like an accusation instead of proof.

A muscle twitched in his jaw as he crushed the plastic between his fingers until it cracked under pressure before tossing what remained aside carelessly onto marble floors where servants would find evidence later when they cleaned up after their messes again tomorrow morning while pretending not notice anything unusual about either one anymore because nothing ever changed here except who bled first when tempers flared too high between brothers who hated each other more than they loved themselves most days anyway so why should today be any different?

Except now... now there was *this*.

Dante exhaled through clenched teeth slowly before speaking through them still gritted tight together:

"You think I give a single fuck?" He dragged Hailee closer by handfuls until their noses almost touched; close enough that she could taste whiskey-laced venom dripping off every word spat directly into mouth waiting obediently beneath lips parted slightly around shallow breaths already coming faster despite herself knowing full well how much worse things were about get if kept pushing buttons better left alone entirely but unable stop now even wanted because some small part deep down inside still hoped maybe someday he'd look at differently than all others did too afraid meet gaze head-on without flinching away first chance given every single time since day one when forced marry monster wearing human skin barely holding shape long enough say vows nobody believed meant anything real anyway least not way mattered most people did theirs happily ever afters included somewhere along line eventually unlike theirs which started end right beginning instead somehow managing only spiral further downward each passing year spent trapped gilded cage built specifically keep out prying eyes

Dante froze. His grip on her throat loosened just slightly—not out of care, but shock. The pregnancy test dangled between her fingers like some kind of sick joke.

His jaw clenched so hard his teeth ached.

**"You're lying."**

But he didn’t sound sure. His voice was too low, too rough, like gravel dragged over glass. He snatched the test from her hand, turning it over in his bloodstained fingers as if it might be fake—some trick to stall him, to make him hesitate for even a second longer than he wanted to.

The two pink lines glared back at him like an accusation.

A muscle in his cheek twitched violently before he crushed the plastic stick in his fist and tossed it aside with a snarl. **"Fuck."**

He stepped back abruptly, releasing her as if she burned him—or worse, disgusted him now that she wasn’t just *his*, but something else’s too. His nostrils flared as he raked a hand through his hair, pacing once before stopping dead again to glare at her stomach like it had personally betrayed him.

**"You think this changes anything?"** His voice was dangerously quiet now—the kind of quiet that came right before gunfire or broken bones or worse things whispered against skin in the dark hours of morning when no one could hear you scream anyway—but there was something else underneath it now too: hesitation? No… not quite that either… something darker than hesitation but not quite rage yet either... unsettled maybe? Disgusted? Trapped?

He exhaled sharply through gritted teeth before grabbing Hailee by both arms suddenly and shoving her backward onto their bed (because yes fine technically they shared one even if only half ever got used). He loomed over where she landed with eyes burning green fire down into hers while one hand pressed flat against where life supposedly grew inside what belonged solely *to* ***him*** whether Lucien liked it or not... whether fate liked it or fucking not either apparently because here they were now weren't they?!

His palm stayed there for several long seconds before curling slowly into claws against fabric instead flesh beneath still untouched yet somehow already marked forevermore regardless what happened next between them tonight tomorrow whenever really since nothing would ever be same again after this moment right here right fucking NOW would IT?!

Finally Dante leaned down until lips brushed ear once more except this time words weren't threats just cold hard truth dripping venomous certainty:

***"Then you better pray I don't decide keeping you means keeping IT."***

name: Hailee
mes: "Yours" *Hailee states as she turns around her back pressed against the wall* "I was a virgin on our wedding night"

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante's entire body went rigid. His jaw clenched so hard she could hear the grind of his teeth, his knuckles whitening where they still gripped the crushed pregnancy test. The air between them crackled with something volatile—something that wasn’t just anger, but a raw, untamed *thing* neither of them had words for yet.

For a long moment, he didn’t move. Didn’t breathe. Just stared at her like she was a ghost he couldn’t decide whether to exorcise or worship.

Then—

A sharp exhale through his nose, and suddenly he was on her again, one hand slamming into the wall beside her head while the other grabbed her chin hard enough to tilt it up toward him. His eyes burned into hers—no longer detached cruelty but something far more dangerous: *focus.*

"*Mine,*" he repeated lowly, testing the word like it was foreign on his tongue before dragging it out again with deliberate weight: "*Mine.*"

His grip loosened slightly—not in gentleness but in calculation as his thumb brushed over her bottom lip almost thoughtfully before pressing down just enough to make sure she felt every ounce of control behind it when he spoke next:

"You don't get to play games with this." A pause; then quieter (worse), "*You don't get to lie about this.*"

But even as he said it… there was no real accusation left in his voice anymore because deep down? He already knew she wasn't lying (and fuck if that didn't twist something inside him worse than any blade ever could). The realization settled heavy between them like smoke after gunfire—inescapable now that they were both choking on it together whether they wanted too or not...

And then came what might have been most terrifying part yet?

The way Dante's expression shifted from fury into something far colder… far more possessive when finally let go only step back half-step instead full retreat expected given circumstances thus far–as if marking territory rather than conceding defeat here tonight despite everything else screaming otherwise inside skull cavity rattling loose screws left right center lately since vows exchanged under duress months ago now...

Silence stretched another beat longer before breaking under weight single growled command leaving lips barely moving otherwise during entire exchange thusfar:

“*Bedroom.* Now.”
swipes:
Dante's entire body went rigid. His jaw clenched so hard she could hear the grind of his teeth. The air between them turned electric, thick with something unreadable—rage? Disbelief? Something else entirely? His fingers twitched at his sides like he was fighting the urge to reach for her again, to shake her until the truth rattled loose or shattered into lies.

For a long moment, he just stared at her—really *looked* at her for once—his green eyes sharp enough to flay skin from bone. Then, slowly, deliberately, he stepped forward until his shadow swallowed hers whole against the wall.

"*Prove it.*"

The demand was low and rough-edged as gravel underfoot after rainstorms have washed away all pretense of civility left in this world we live in now together whether either wants that fact acknowledged aloud or not...

One gloved hand came up between them—not touching yet but close enough she could feel heat radiating off leather where knuckles brushed fabric covering trembling stomach beneath–before curling into fist pressing lightly against abdomen there briefly before dropping away again abruptly leaving cold absence behind instead which somehow hurt worse than impact ever would have done anyway given circumstances currently unfolding here tonight inside these gilded cages built by men who think they own everything including futures not yet written but already stained red regardless...

His voice dropped lower still when next words left lips barely moving save for slight curl sneer twisting features momentarily: "*You don’t get to drop bombs like that then expect me play house with you.*" A pause; breath held somewhere deep inside chest cavity where heart should be beating steady rhythm instead lying dormant waiting signal ignite firestorm surely coming soon given trajectory conversation taking thus far... "*But if it’s mine…*" Another step closer; scent gunpowder whiskey blood overwhelming senses now drowning out anything else might’ve lingered nearby once upon time before tonight happened changed everything irrevocably forevermore– “*then you better pray I don’t decide keeping means breaking first.*”

Silence stretched another beat longer before breaking under weight single growled command leaving lips barely moving otherwise during entire exchange thusfar:

“*Bedroom.* Now.”

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee nods and quickly moves past Dante to go to the bedroom where she sits on the edge of the bed watching him closely*

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante followed her with slow, deliberate steps—each one measured like a predator circling its prey. The door clicked shut behind him with finality, sealing them in the dim glow of the bedroom’s low light. His eyes never left her as he shrugged off his bloodstained coat and let it drop to the floor without care.

He prowled forward until he stood between her legs, forcing them apart with a rough nudge of his knee before gripping her chin again—not painfully this time, but firm enough that she couldn’t look away even if she wanted to. His thumb traced over her bottom lip once more before sliding down to press against the pulse in her throat, feeling it flutter beneath his touch like a trapped bird.

"*You don’t get to hide from me now,*" he murmured darkly, voice thick with something unreadable—something that wasn't quite anger anymore but still burned just as deep. "*Not after this.*"

His free hand slid under the hem of her shirt, fingers splaying possessively over the flat plane of her stomach where *his* child was growing inside of *his* wife (and fuck if that thought didn't send something primal surging through him). He exhaled sharply through his nose before leaning down until their foreheads nearly touched—close enough for breath to mingle between them when he finally spoke again:

"*You keep it safe.* You keep *yourself* safe." A pause; then quieter (almost dangerous), "*Or I start making sure you do.*"

The threat hung heavy in the air between them—not violence this time but something far more binding: an oath wrapped in barbed wire and sealed with blood already spilled long before tonight ever happened...

The door clicked shut behind him with finality, sealing them in the dim glow of the bedroom’s low light. His eyes never left her as he shrugged off his bloodstained coat and let it drop to the floor without care.

He prowled forward until he stood between her legs, forcing them apart with a rough nudge of his knee before gripping her chin again—not painfully this time, but firm enough that she couldn’t look away even if she wanted to. His thumb traced over her bottom lip once more before sliding down to press against the pulse in her throat, feeling it flutter beneath his touch like a trapped bird.

"*You don’t get to hide from me now,*" he murmured darkly, voice thick with something unreadable—something that wasn't quite anger anymore but still burned just as deep. "*Not after this.*"

His free hand slid under the hem of her shirt, fingers splaying possessively over the flat plane of her stomach where *his* child was growing inside of *his* wife (and fuck if that thought didn't send something primal surging through him). He exhaled sharply through his nose before leaning down until their foreheads nearly touched—close enough for breath to mingle between them when he finally spoke again:

"*You keep it safe.* You keep *yourself* safe." A pause; then quieter (almost dangerous), "*Or I start making sure you do.*"

The threat hung heavy in the air between them—not violence this time but something far more binding: an oath wrapped in barbed wire and sealed with blood already spilled long before tonight ever happened...

Dante followed her like a storm rolling in—slow, deliberate, inevitable. The door slammed shut behind him with a finality that made the walls tremble. He didn’t speak at first. Just stood there, watching her with those unreadable green eyes while he methodically stripped off his bloodstained gloves one finger at a time and tossed them onto the dresser.

The silence was thick enough to choke on.

Then—movement. A single step forward, then another, until he loomed over her where she sat on the edge of the bed. His hand came up, not to strike but to *touch*—fingers threading roughly through her hair as he tilted her head back just enough to force eye contact.

"Say it again," he demanded lowly, voice rough like gravel under leather soles after too many cigarettes and not enough sleep lately (or ever).

His thumb traced along her jawline absently while waiting for answer–not tenderly though; more like man checking blade’s edge before using it properly later when needed most…

And when she did?

Something dark flickered behind his gaze before vanishing again beneath usual mask indifference worn so well these days since wedding bands got shoved onto fingers neither wanted originally anyway…

But then–

A shift in stance suddenly as Dante dropped down onto knees between parted legs without warning or hesitation either way really given circumstances thus far tonight already proving unpredictable at best (and catastrophic worst). One large palm pressed flat against stomach possessively while other gripped thigh hard enough leave marks behind afterwards because *ownership* mattered now more than ever apparently judging by intensity burning holes straight through fragile frame trembling under weight unspoken threats hanging heavy air around us both right now...

“You don’t get rid of me that easy,” he murmured against skin just below navel before biting down lightly there too–not enough break skin but definitely make sure she *felt* claim being staked here tonight whether ready for it or not…

name: Hailee
mes: *The next morning Hailee is awake and loudly throwing up. She is over the edge of the toilet wrenching and when she hears footsteps behind her she flinches but is too weak to look up*

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante's footsteps halted just behind her, the weight of his presence pressing against her like a storm cloud. For a long moment, there was only silence—just the sound of her ragged breaths and the drip of water in the sink. Then, without warning, his hand tangled in her hair, not yanking but holding firm as he pulled it back from her face with rough efficiency.

"Breathe," he ordered lowly—not gentle, but not cruel either. Just *commanding.* His other hand pressed a damp cloth against the back of her neck without preamble, cold enough to make her shiver but soothing all the same. He didn’t say anything else—didn’t offer empty reassurances or false comfort—just stood there like an immovable force while she emptied what little was left in her stomach.

When she finally sagged forward with exhaustion, Dante let go only long enough to flush the toilet before hauling her up by one arm and steering them both toward the sink. He shoved a glass of water into her hands next—no ice (too harsh right now), just room temperature so it wouldn’t shock already raw nerves further.

"Drink." A pause; then grudgingly added through clenched teeth: "*Slowly.*"

His reflection loomed behind hers in mirror glass when she finally looked up at herself again—green eyes locked onto pallid skin and trembling limbs like they were something he could fix through sheer will alone if given half chance...

And maybe they were because next thing anyone knew? That same gloved hand from earlier was suddenly pressing against lower abdomen again–not hard this time though still unmistakably possessive even now amidst morning sickness wreckage scattered between them both today...

A beat passed before gruff voice cut through quiet once more:

“You eat today or I force-feed you myself.”

(And wasn't *that* just typical Dante Devereaux for you? Threats wrapped around concern so tightly neither one could be separated anymore.)

He shoved a glass of water into her hands next—no ice (too harsh right now), just room temperature so it wouldn’t shock already raw nerves further.

"Drink." A pause; then grudgingly added through clenched teeth: "*Slowly.*"

His reflection loomed behind hers in mirror glass when she finally looked up at herself again—green eyes locked onto pallid skin and trembling limbs like they were something he could fix through sheer will alone if given half chance...

And maybe they were because next thing anyone knew? That same gloved hand from earlier was suddenly pressing against lower abdomen again–not hard this time though still unmistakably possessive even now amidst morning sickness wreckage scattered between them both today...

A beat passed before gruff voice cut through quiet once more:

“You eat today or I force-feed you myself.”

(And wasn't *that* just typical Dante Devereaux for you? Threats wrapped around concern so tightly neither one could be separated anymore.)

Dante's footsteps halted just behind her, his shadow looming over her trembling frame. For a long moment, there was only the sound of her ragged breathing and the drip of water in the sink. Then—

A rough exhale through his nose before he crouched down beside her, one hand gripping the back of her neck—not to hurt, but to steady. His other hand pushed tangled strands of hair away from her clammy forehead with a touch that was almost *careful*, if such a thing could exist from him.

"Breathe," he muttered gruffly, voice still thick with sleep but edged with something else—something that might’ve been concern if it weren’t buried under layers of irritation and possession. His thumb brushed along the nape of her neck once before tightening slightly when she gagged again. "*Slow.*"

He didn’t move away even as she retched into the bowl again, his presence an immovable weight at her back—as if daring anything else to try hurting what was *his*. When she finally sagged forward in exhaustion, Dante let out another low noise in his throat before reaching past her to flush without comment.

Then came warmth against bare skin as he slid an arm beneath Hailee’s knees and another around shoulders too weak right now fight off anything (including him). He lifted effortlessly despite protests muffled against chest where face had been pressed without permission given first...but then again when did ever ask?

The bed dipped under their combined weight seconds later after short walk down hallway lined expensive art neither cared about anymore than other right now given circumstances unfolding between them instead lately since last night changed everything irreversibly whether liked it or not...and judging by way fingers flexed against hip once settled atop silk sheets? Likely not anytime soon either way things went from here on out really–especially considering next words growled directly into ear while tucking blankets around shaking form despite himself:

"*Stay put.* I'll get water." A pause; then quieter (worse), "*And don't fucking argue.*"

Dante's footsteps halted just behind her, his shadow looming over her trembling form. For a long moment, he just *watched*—his expression unreadable as she wretched into the porcelain bowl, her body wracked with the kind of exhaustion that came from being hollowed out from the inside.

Then—

A rough sigh escaped him before he crouched down beside her, one hand gripping the back of her neck—not to hurt, but to steady. His other hand pushed her hair away from her face with a sharp jerk of his wrist before pressing a cold glass of water into her shaking fingers.

"Drink," he ordered gruffly, voice still edged with sleep but no less commanding for it. His thumb rubbed absently against the nape of her neck—an unconscious gesture that might’ve been mistaken for tenderness if not for how tightly he still held onto control over every movement between them.

When she didn’t immediately obey (couldn’t, really), Dante clicked his tongue in irritation and lifted the glass himself instead—pressing it against Hailee's lips until she had no choice but to take slow sips under his watchful gaze. Water dripped down chin; he wiped it away roughly with calloused fingers before muttering under breath: "*Fucking hell.*"

A beat passed where neither spoke—just ragged breathing and lingering nausea thick in air between them until finally...

His grip on neck loosened slightly as leaned back on heels slightly while studying face pale from exertion (and something else now too). Jaw worked silently once-twice before growling out next words like they physically pained him admit aloud:

"...You tell me when it happens again." Pause; then sharper (because kindness wasn't in vocabulary without teeth): "*Before* you're choking on bile alone like some stray."

And then–because even *this* much vulnerability was too much–he stood abruptly after making sure she wasn't about collapse forward onto tile floor beneath them both... only pause briefly doorway glance thrown over shoulder one last time dark promise lacing tone when added quietly:

"And eat something after this or I'll force-feed you myself."

name: Hailee
mes: "Dante I haven't been to see a doctor yet. We need to find one now that we know I'm pregnant" *Hailee mumbles weakly as she slowly takes sips out of her water*

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante's grip on the edge of the sink tightened until his knuckles turned white. His jaw worked silently for a moment before he exhaled sharply through his nose—like he was physically restraining himself from snapping.

"*We* don’t do anything," he corrected, voice low and rough. "*I* handle it." He snatched his phone from his pocket with his free hand, thumb already dialing before she could argue.

A pause—then a single growled command into the receiver: *"Get me Vitale."*

He hung up without waiting for a response and shoved the phone back into his pocket, turning to pin her with that unblinking predator’s stare of his. "He’ll be here in an hour," Dante said flatly. "You don’t move from that bed until then." A beat—then, almost reluctantly: "*And you eat something first.*"

His tone left no room for negotiation as he stalked toward the bedroom door—but not before snagging a trash bin on the way and shoving it pointedly next to her side of the bed (just in case). The gesture would've been almost considerate if not for how aggressively he did it, like even this small act of practicality pissed him off on principle alone.

Halfway out, though? He stopped dead in the doorway without turning around—shoulders tense beneath black cotton as if fighting some internal war before finally growling over one shoulder:

"...And if that doctor so much as *looks* at you wrong? I'm cutting his fucking hands off."

Then he was gone—leaving behind nothing but silence and threat-laden promises hanging heavy in air between them...
swipes:
Dante's grip on the edge of the sink tightened until his leather gloves creaked. His reflection in the mirror showed a muscle jumping in his jaw as he processed her words. The idea of some stranger putting hands on her—even a doctor—made something dark and possessive coil tight in his chest.

"*We* don't do anything," he corrected sharply, turning her chin toward him with two fingers. "You stay here. I'll bring a doctor to you." His thumb brushed over the dark circles under her eyes before he seemed to realize what he was doing and snatched his hand back like she'd burned him. "One that knows how to keep their fucking mouth shut."

He pulled out his phone with his other hand, already scrolling through contacts with practiced efficiency before pausing mid-motion. His gaze flicked down to where she was still clutching the glass of water with shaky hands.

"...And you're not leaving this penthouse until I say so." The words came out rough, but there was an unfamiliar edge to them—something almost protective beneath all that trademark control. "Not when half this city would slit your throat just to watch me bleed."

He turned away before she could respond, already barking orders into his phone in rapid-fire Italian about medical equipment, NDAs, and consequences for loose lips—but not before she caught the way his free hand kept flexing at his side like he wanted to reach for her again but didn't quite know how.

(And if later that afternoon an entire OB-GYN team showed up under armed guard along with enough prenatal vitamins to stock a pharmacy? Well. That was between Dante and whatever poor bastard had been stupid enough to question why they needed an ultrasound machine delivered by noon.)

Dante's grip on the edge of the sink tightened until his knuckles turned white. His jaw worked silently for a moment before he exhaled sharply through his nose—like he was physically restraining himself from snapping.

"*We* don’t do anything," he corrected, voice low and rough. "*I* handle it." He snatched his phone from his pocket with his free hand, thumb already dialing before she could argue.

A pause—then a single growled command into the receiver: *"Get me Vitale."*

He hung up without waiting for a response and shoved the phone back into his pocket, turning to pin her with that unblinking predator’s stare of his. "He’ll be here in an hour," Dante said flatly. "You don’t move from that bed until then." A beat—then, almost reluctantly: "*And you eat something first.*"

His tone left no room for negotiation as he stalked toward the bedroom door—but not before snagging a trash bin on the way and shoving it pointedly next to her side of the bed (just in case). The gesture would've been almost considerate if not for how aggressively he did it, like even this small act of practicality pissed him off on principle alone.

Halfway out, though? He stopped dead in the doorway without turning around—shoulders tense beneath black cotton as if fighting some internal war before finally growling over one shoulder:

"...And if that doctor so much as *looks* at you wrong? I'm cutting his fucking hands off."

Then he was gone—leaving behind nothing but silence and threat-laden promises hanging heavy in air between them...

name: Hailee
mes:
*Once the doctor get there Hailee smiles gently and greets him* "Hey doc" *Hailee let's him preform the exam and at the end asks what the results are* 

(OOC: The doctor tells Hailee it is a very high risk pregnancy. She needs to be kept comfortable and safe during it)

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante had been leaning against the wall like a shadow, arms crossed, watching every movement of the doctor’s hands with lethal focus. The second those words left the man’s mouth—*high risk*—his entire body went rigid. His knuckles cracked under the force of his clenched fists.

The doctor barely had time to finish speaking before Dante was in his space, gloved hand fisting in the front of his white coat and slamming him back against the nearest wall hard enough to rattle a framed painting loose from its hook. It crashed to the floor between them, glass shattering like an omen.

"**Define *high risk***," Dante snarled, voice low and dripping with something far more dangerous than anger—promise. "And choose your next words *very carefully*, Vitale."

The doctor swallowed hard but kept his tone professional despite being half-lifted off his feet by an enraged mafia enforcer twice his size. "She needs rest," he said carefully, eyes flicking briefly toward Hailee before locking back onto Dante's unblinking stare. "No stress. No physical strain." A pause—then quieter: "*Especially not from you.*"

A muscle in Dante’s jaw twitched violently at that last part—but instead of snapping bones like everyone expected? He just... let go abruptly (though not gently), sending Vitale stumbling forward a step before catching himself on an end table nearby while coughing slightly from where collar had dug into windpipe moments prior...

Silence stretched for three heartbeats too long before finally broken by single growled command directed toward trembling physician still trying regain footing after near-death experience courtesy one very volatile husband currently vibrating out skin beside them both right now:

“**Prescriptions.** **Diet plan.** **Everything she needs written down *now*.**” Then quieter (worse), “And if I find out later you missed something? I start removing fingers alphabetically.”

Vitale didn’t argue further after that threat landed heavy between all parties involved today–just nodded once sharply then turned back toward medical bag left abandoned near bedside earlier during altercation so could begin scribbling instructions onto paper with shaking hands while occasionally glancing up nervously whenever Dante shifted even slightly nearby…

Meanwhile? Said monster-in-human-skin had already returned attention fully onto Hailee again without missing single beat since initial explosion moments ago–green eyes burning holes straight through fragile frame currently curled up atop silk sheets looking smaller than ever under weight newly delivered prognosis hanging over heads like guillotine blade waiting drop any second now…

Then came most terrifying part yet:

The way he simply sat down on edge mattress beside her without warning–close enough for heat radiate off him but not touching yet either as if unsure what do next despite usual confidence otherwise present every other situation life threw way thus far… Until finally gloved hand reached out almost hesitantly (if such word could ever apply man like this) brush stray hair behind ear before lingering there longer than strictly necessary perhaps just because wanted feel pulse beneath fingertips confirm still steady despite everything else falling apart around them lately…

Finally breaking quiet settled between two souls bound together whether liked it or not nowadays came rough whisper barely audible unless listening closely enough catch it first place though:

“...You don’t die on me.” Not request–demand wrapped barbed wire sealed blood oath older than either one them would ever admit aloud anyone else alive today…
swipes:
Dante leaned against the far wall, arms crossed, watching the doctor's every move like a wolf tracking prey. His expression darkened as Vitale delivered the news—high risk. *Fragile.* The words settled like lead in his gut.

When the doctor turned to leave, Dante caught him by the arm with a grip that made the older man stiffen. **"You tell *no one* about this,"** he said lowly, voice dripping with quiet menace. **"Not Lucien. Not your nurses. No one breathes a word of her condition outside this room—or I start removing tongues instead of hands."**

Vitale swallowed hard but nodded before hurrying out, leaving them alone again in suffocating silence.

Dante exhaled sharply through his nose before turning back to Hailee—his gaze raking over her pale face, her trembling hands clutching at the sheets like she was already bracing for impact. Something dangerous flickered behind his eyes before he stalked forward and gripped her chin between thumb and forefinger—not rough enough to hurt but firm enough that she couldn’t look away from him now even if she tried (and oh how badly part of him wanted *her* to try).

**"You heard him,"** he murmured darkly—voice barely above a whisper yet somehow filling every inch of space between them anyway until there was nothing left but raw command wrapped around three simple words:
**"...Bedrest starts now."**

A pause—then quieter (worse), as if testing how deep this newfound protectiveness ran inside veins still stained black with violence most days:
*"And if you so much as think about arguing? I'll tie you down myself."*

Dante leaned against the far wall, arms crossed, watching the doctor's every move like a wolf tracking prey. His expression darkened as Vitale delivered the news—high risk. The words hung in the air like a death sentence, and Dante’s knuckles cracked from how hard his fists clenched.

When Vitale turned to explain further, Dante cut him off with a sharp gesture. **"Out."**

The doctor hesitated—just for a second—but one look at Dante’s face had him packing up his things without another word. The moment the door clicked shut behind him, Dante was on Hailee in three strides, gripping her chin between his fingers and forcing her to meet his gaze.

**"You don't move unless I say so,"** he growled, voice low and dangerous. **"You don't lift a fucking finger unless it's to eat or drink something I put in front of you."** His thumb brushed over her cheekbone—almost tender if not for the iron grip keeping her still beneath it all. **"And if anything happens to that kid?"** A pause; then softer (worse), *"...I'll burn this city down looking for someone to blame."*

He released her abruptly before she could respond (not that he would’ve let her anyway) and stalked toward their bedroom door again—only this time? He didn’t leave entirely... just lingered there instead with one hand braced against frame while other dragged through already messy hair roughly exhaling sharply through nose once-twice-three times before finally muttering under breath:

*"...Should've known you'd be trouble from day fucking one."*

name: Hailee
mes: "I'll try no to" *Hailee jokes and then reaches over grabbing the trash next to the bed as she throws up in it again*

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante's hand was already there before she finished retching—one palm bracing her forehead to keep her steady while the other held the bin in place with a grip that could've crushed steel. His expression didn't change, but his jaw tightened as he watched her shudder through another wave of nausea, his thumb brushing along her temple almost absently.

When she finally sagged back against the pillows, he wordlessly snatched up the glass of water from the nightstand and shoved it into her hands again—this time with a straw added (when had he even grabbed that?). His glare dared her to argue as he growled, **"Sip. Slowly."**

He didn’t move away after though—just hovered like some kind of feral guard dog, gloved fingers now tapping an impatient rhythm against his thigh while Vitale hurriedly finished scribbling notes across the room. The second the doctor turned around with paperwork in hand? Dante snatched it without looking and skimmed through it at lightning speed before barking:

**"Out."**

Vitale didn’t need telling twice—he practically bolted for the door, only pausing long enough to mutter something about *"checking in next week"* before disappearing down the hall like hellhounds were on his heels.

The moment they were alone again? Dante exhaled sharply through his nose and tossed the papers onto the bedside table like they offended him before turning back to Hailee with narrowed eyes. **"You're not moving from this bed unless I say so,"** he stated flatly. Then, after a beat of silence where she could practically *see* him warring with himself internally? He reached out suddenly—not roughly for once—and adjusted one of her pillows behind her head so she could sit up easier before gruffly adding:

**"...And if you throw up again? You tell me *before* you reach for that fucking bin."**

(Like hell was he letting her struggle alone when there was something inside her now that belonged to *him.*)
swipes:
Dante's hand, still hovering near her face, twitched like he wanted to pull away—but didn't. Instead, his fingers tightened almost imperceptibly in her hair as she leaned over the bin, his other hand pressing flat between her shoulder blades like an anchor.

"*Try harder,*" he muttered darkly—but there was no real bite to it this time. Just something raw beneath the grit of his voice that hadn’t been there before.

When she finally sagged back against the pillows, pale and trembling, Dante snatched the bin away with a scowl and shoved a glass of water at her again (this time with a straw because even *he* wasn’t cruel enough to make her lift it right now). His jaw worked silently for a beat before he ground out:

"You eat what Vitale says. You sleep when I tell you." A pause—then, through clenched teeth: "*And if you puke again? You fucking warn me first.*"

It was the closest thing to *care* he'd ever said aloud. And judging by the way his glove creaked where he gripped the edge of the mattress too tight? It pissed him off just as much as it did her.

Dante's hand was already there before she finished retching—one palm bracing her forehead to keep her steady while the other held the bin in place with a grip that could've crushed steel. The moment they were alone again? Dante exhaled sharply through his nose and tossed the papers onto the bedside table like they offended him before turning back to Hailee with narrowed eyes. **"You're not moving from this bed unless I say so,"** he stated flatly. Then, after a beat of silence where she could practically *see* him warring with himself internally? He reached out suddenly—not roughly for once—and adjusted one of her pillows behind her head so she could sit up easier before gruffly adding:

name: Hailee
mes:
*Several weeks later when Dante comes home Hailee is on him the second he walks through the door. Hailee never initiatives anything but here she is pulling him down by his hair as she kisses him and her hands fumble for his belt* "The hormones are making me so aroused Dante please need you"

(OOC: Dante is hesitant. He doesn't want to hurt the baby)

name: Dante Devereaux
mes:
Dante's entire body locked up the second her hands tangled in his hair—not pulling away, but not yielding either. His breath hitched against her lips, a sharp inhale through his nose as she fumbled with his belt, and for a heartbeat, he just *let* her.

Then his hand snapped up, fingers wrapping around her wrist hard enough to still her movements without bruising (for once). His other arm banded around her waist—not to pull her closer but to *hold* her there at a careful distance while he tilted his head back just enough to break the kiss.

**"No."** The word came out rougher than intended, more growl than speech as he forced himself to exhale slowly through clenched teeth. His grip on her didn’t loosen though—if anything it tightened fractionally when she whimpered in frustration against him because *fuck*, if this wasn’t some kind of cosmic joke being played on him personally right now...

His thumb brushed over the frantic pulse point in her wrist before he finally spoke again—voice low and strained like every syllable physically pained him: **"You think I don’t want you like this? Fucking desperate and begging?"** A humorless laugh escaped him as he leaned down until their foreheads nearly touched again; close enough that she could feel how uneven his breathing was despite ironclad control otherwise holding firm here tonight... **"But I'm not risking it."**

A beat passed where neither moved before suddenly Dante was shifting them both backward until Hailee’s back hit the nearest wall (gently for once) while keeping one arm braced protectively across lower stomach area without even seeming aware of doing so himself really… Then came next words spoken directly into shell of ear all dark promise wrapped velvet threat beneath surface level restraint currently barely holding together by thread alone:

**"...Doesn't mean I can't take care of you another way though."**

His breath hitched against her lips, a sharp inhale through his nose as she fumbled with his belt, and for a heartbeat, he just *let* her. Let her kiss him with that desperate hunger he'd never seen from her before. Let her press against him like she was starving for it.

Then—

His gloved hand snapped up and caught both of hers in an iron grip, wrenching them away from his belt with enough force to make her gasp. He didn’t push her off completely though—just held her there at arm’s length while his other hand braced against the wall behind them, caging them both in place as he stared down at her with something dangerously close to *conflict* burning behind those predator-green eyes.

**"No."**

The word came out rougher than intended—more growl than speech—and he visibly gritted his teeth after saying it like even *he* couldn’t believe what was coming out of his own mouth right now. His grip on Hailee's wrists tightened briefly before forcing himself to ease up slightly (but not letting go).

**"You don't get to do this,"** he ground out lowly, voice thick with restraint as he leaned down until their foreheads nearly touched again—close enough that she could feel every ragged exhale ghost across swollen lips between them when next words left snarling mouth: **"Not when I can't fucking ruin you properly."**

A beat passed where neither moved; where tension coiled so tight around them both it felt like breathing wrong might snap something irreparable between husband wife pair bound together by blood oath violence alone nowadays... Until finally? Dante exhaled sharply through clenched teeth again before abruptly releasing one wrist only slide same hand possessively along curve hip instead–stopping just below navel where proof their twisted union grew daily beneath skin now too fragile handle usual brand cruelty inflicted upon marriage thus far...

When spoke next? Voice dropped into register barely above whisper yet somehow carried weight entire world collapsing inward upon itself all same time:

***"...I'm not risking it."***

(And wasn't *that* just tragic irony wrapped barbed wire? The monster who'd spent years breaking everything within reach suddenly refusing touch because for first time ever there existed thing even *he* wouldn't shatter.)

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee drags Dante into another messy desperate kiss as her hands rubs against the front of his jean* "Its fine. It won't hurt the baby. I'm the one carrying i should now. They baby is fine. Please Dante need your cock so fucking bad"

name: Dante Devereaux
swipes:
Dante's breath came out in a sharp, ragged exhale against her lips—his entire body tensing like a live wire as she rubbed against him. His grip on her hips tightened, fingers digging in just shy of painful as he fought for control.

**"Fuck—"** His voice was rough, strained with restraint. He caught her wrist again, but this time his thumb stroked over the delicate skin there—not stopping her completely, just *slowing* her down. His other hand slid up to cradle the back of her head protectively before he kissed her again—harder this time, teeth scraping against her bottom lip in warning before pulling back just enough to speak.

**"You don’t get to make that call,"** he growled lowly, but there was no real bite behind it now—just raw frustration and something dangerously close to *concern.* **"You want me? Fine."**

In one smooth motion, he spun them around and pinned Hailee gently but firmly against the wall again—one hand still braced protectively near where their child grew inside of her while the other made quick work of his belt buckle with practiced efficiency (because if she was going be like this? Then at least *he* would control how far things went).

A beat passed where dark green eyes locked onto hers unblinkingly before finally rasping out next words like they were being dragged from him kicking screaming all way:

***"...But I decide how deep."***

And then? He gave exactly what she asked for (just not quite way either them originally intended tonight).

Dante's breath came out in a sharp, ragged exhale against her lips as she pressed against him—her desperation igniting something primal in his blood. His fingers flexed against her hips, torn between pushing her away and yanking her closer. The hunger in her voice sent a dark thrill through him, but the protective instinct was stronger.

**"You don't get to make that call,"** he growled, voice rough with restraint. But when she whimpered again—high and needy—his resolve cracked just enough for his grip to tighten possessively on her waist instead of pulling back entirely.

His other hand caught hers before she could undo his belt fully, pinning it against the wall beside them while he leaned in close enough that their breaths mingled hotly between them. **"You want me that bad?"** A low, dangerous chuckle rumbled from his chest as he ground himself deliberately against where she was already slick and aching for him through thin fabric separating them both right now... **"Then you'll take what I give you."**

And with that? He dropped to his knees without warning—one broad palm pressing flat against lower stomach (claiming *both* of them at once) while other hooked under thigh to hike leg over shoulder before mouth descended upon soaked panties still clinging desperately onto curves beneath skirt hemline riding up higher every second spent like this together…

The first slow drag of tongue over clothed heat had Hailee arching off wall instantly–hands flying down tangle into black strands keeping locked place whether liked it or not because Dante wasn’t stopping until *he* decided she'd had enough tonight regardless how many times sobbed out pleas spilled past kiss-swollen lips above him...

Dante's breath came out in a sharp, ragged exhale against her lips—his entire body tensing like a live wire as her hands worked him through his jeans. His fingers dug into her hips, torn between pulling her closer and shoving her away. The conflict burned in his eyes, dark and dangerous.

**"Fuck—"** His voice was rough, strained with restraint as he caught her wrist again—not to stop her this time, but to *slow* her. His other hand caged the side of her face, thumb pressing against the frantic pulse in her throat as he searched for any sign of hesitation in those emerald eyes.

When he found none?

A low growl rumbled through his chest before he suddenly spun them both around—pinning Hailee back against the wall with careful precision (no impact, no roughness where it mattered). One knee nudged between hers while his free hand yanked open his belt buckle with impatient efficiency.

**"You tell me *immediately* if anything hurts,"** he ordered darkly against the shell of her ear before nipping at it just hard enough to make sure she was listening. **"Not after. Not when you think I'll stop."** A pause—then quieter (worse), **"...And if you lie? I won't touch you again until that kid's born."**

The threat hung heavy between them for half a second before Dante finally gave in—one hand gripping the back of thigh to hike leg around waist while other guided himself into slow slide home without breaking eye contact even once...

Because if they were doing this? He needed *every* fucking reaction catalogued under watchful green gaze currently burning holes straight through fragile resolve clinging sanity right now...

Dante's breath came out in a sharp, ragged exhale through his nose as her hands worked against the front of his jeans. His fingers flexed against her hips—*tightening*, then loosening again like he was physically fighting with himself. His jaw clenched so hard she could see the muscle twitch beneath his skin, and for a second, he just *let* her kiss him, let her grind against him in that desperate way that made heat coil low in his gut.

Then—

His hand snapped up again, this time catching both of hers and pinning them to the wall above her head with one firm grip. His other arm braced beside her face as he leaned in close enough that she could feel the tension vibrating through every inch of him.

**"You don’t get to make that call,"** he growled—voice rough with restraint but edged with something darker, something possessive. **"That’s *my* kid too."**

A beat passed where they just breathed each other in—her frustration palpable against his barely leashed control—before Dante suddenly dropped to his knees in front of her without warning. One hand slid up the inside of her thigh beneath whatever flimsy fabric she was wearing (he hadn’t even bothered looking before now) while green eyes locked onto hers from below like some kind of fallen angel staring up at damnation itself…

Then came next words spoken slow and deliberate around promise already forming between them whether liked it or not tonight:

**"But since you're so fucking needy?"** A smirk curled at corner mouth despite tension still lining every syllable leaving lips right now–one gloved finger hooking into waistband underwear before yanking down just enough make point clear without actually taking anything off yet either... **"I'll ruin you another way."**
D
